title: Ticket #4529: No user feedback if job cannot run due to user missing on exec node
description:
If a job cannot be run on an execute due to the user it is trying to run as not existing, the only place where I can find that out is via the StarterLog on the execute node, which contains lines like: 

passwd_cache::cache_uid(): getpwnam("rsv") failed: user not found
ERROR: Uid for "rsv" not found in passwd file and SOFT_UID_DOMAIN is False
ERROR: Failed to determine what user to run this job as, aborting
Failed to initialize JobInfoCommunicator, aborting
Unable to start job.
**** condor_starter (condor_STARTER) pid 10866 EXITING WITH STATUS 1

This does not get relayed to the user; the job just remains idle and tries to match again (possibly matching to the same machine). Is there a way that can be changed? Zach suggests the job should go on hold instead.

I tested this on a two-node setup using the OSG's RPMs, with one head node and one execute node. The user I was trying to use existed on the head node (where I was submitting from) but did not exist on the execute node. Both machines were part of the same UID_DOMAIN and FILESYSTEM_DOMAIN.
